job_title: Charge Nurse in San Francisco, CA
pros: - Staff and Residents are fun to work with - Good learning experience
cons: - I don’t really have any unpleasant experience in the building.

review_title: Okay training ground to start career
job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) in San Francisco, CA
pros: - I enjoyed my time working with fellow LVN's and CNA's
cons:
- High staff turnover in 6 most or less.
- Weak structure, planning and implementation
- Uncompetitive pay

job_title: Social Worker in San Francisco, CA
pros: Friendly work environment, coworkers and supervisors
cons: Questionable policies and lack of top level attention to systemic problems facing lower SES clients.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Francisco, CA
cons: Low pay and frequently short staffed

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
-Higher pay than the average healthcare organization for administration side staff.
-Room for advancement
-If they like you, you'll see raises frequently
-The residents are super sweet
-Great nursing staff/ line staff
cons:
-Money is poorly managed
-Senior management are by and large bullies (they are just plain mean and many are scared of them!)
-Senior management are a tight group of director levels who have an attitude of superiority and are overpaid for the volume of work produced
-They play favorites and pay accordingly

job_title: Anonymous Employee in South San Francisco, CA
pros:
HealthCare Benefits

cons:
